result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan S. Kovars was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Not to possess or consume alcohol or any mood-altering substances without prescription.

Not to enter any bars, taverns, or any establishment that sells alcohol by the individual drink.

No contact with Brent Wegner or Marion McNamer.
Cooperate with any assessment or treatment program deemed necessary by the Department of Corrections.

Per RCSD, credit is 44 days.
#2 - Adult Conduct Report
#1 - Intake Report

Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars in court, in custody, with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing in 16CF30/substantial battery, count 1 and 16CF48/possession of burglarious tools, count 1.  Def objects to statements in PSI.  Sworn testimony taken from PSI author, Agent DP.  DA Harper argues State's position on sentence. Atty. Whitney argues Defense' position on sentencing.

Court orders sentences as follows:

16CF30 - maximum - total sentence of 42 months with 18 months initial conf. and 24 mo ES, consecutive to time def serving now.  Conditions of ES:  follows PSI recommendation - not to possess/consume alcohol or mood-altering substances without prescription; not to enter any bars/taverns; DNA sample; assts/treatment as ordered; court costs.  1 set of costs imposed.  Rest. $1455 to BW and $1084.99 to Mobil Mart.  No contact with BW or MM.  Credit for time served:  to be determined by Richland County Jail and provided to counsel for clerk's production of JOC.  Eligible for any of the treatment programs at the prison.  Firearms admonishment provided.

16CF48 - sentence withheld for 3 years probation, consecutive to the sentences def is serving in 16CF30 and the other charge (16CF49).  No costs.
Cases called together (#16CF49, 16CF48, 16CF30, 16CF10)
Sentencing hearing on June 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

16CF49, 16CF10, 16CF30, 16CF48/arraignment.  

Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars in court, in custody, with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA informs the Court that the parties have a resolution calling for def's pleas to various felony counts; informations being filed in all but 16CF10 which will be dismissed.  DA states the parties' agreement which calls for def's pleas to count 1, felony bail jumping, in 16CF49; count 1, substantial battery, in 16CF30; and count 1, possession of burglarious tools, in 16CF48; other counts to be either dismissed/read-in, or dismissed outright; counsel will be asking for PSI.  Def pleads guilty to the three counts stated.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  

DA asks for sentencing in one matter yet today with the rest to follow PSI; states rationale.  In 16CF49 - counsel jointly recommend 3 in/3 out; ask for PSI's in the remaining cases.  Court's colloquy with def.  Def wants to proceed with sentencing in 16CF49 today.  Court sentences def to 6 years WI State Prison with 3 years in and 3 years e.s.  Def to submit DNA sample if haven't already.  Def states he submitted it upon arrest.  0 days credit in 16CF49.  Court finds def eligible for all programming.  Must pay costs; that to be a condition of ext. supervision.  Atty. W states def is asking for concurrent sentences in all three cases; may move to reopen credit in 16CF49 at the time of sentencing in the other matters on June 3rd.

PSI ordered in 16CF30 and 16CF48.
Arraignment on April 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars in court, in custody, with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  16CF30, 16C F10, 16CF48, and 16CF49, all on the calendar for prelim today.  Atty. Whitney presents the Court with def's waiver of prelim form.  Counsel have advised the Court that the parties wish to proceed to swift resolution in these matters.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of prelim.  Court accepts the waiver and orders def boundover for trial.  DA asks for arraignment date within 30 days.  Atty. W asks for date within 2 weeks.  Court sets arraignment for April 18th at 10.

DA notes request of bond poster TB for her money back in 16CF30; DA has no objection; Atty. W has no objection.  Court orders cash bond returned in 16CF30.  Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars in court, in custody, with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  

16CF48 and 16CF49 called together for initial appearance, along with adjourned initials in 16CF30 and 16CF10.  

Formal reading waived and charges stated in all cases.  Court has also informed def of his rights including right to prelim.  Counsel request prelim scheduling in all four cases. 

Atty. Whitney asks for modification of the 2k cash bond in 16CF49.  DA argues against modification of that bond; believes it was appropriately set.  Def addresses the Court.  Court takes 16CF49 bond down to $1k cash.

Prelims set for April 7 at 9.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant from the Richland County Jail.

Attorney Jameson R. Whitney in court for Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail, in custody.  16CF10/adjourned initial, 16CF30/adjourned initial, and bail hearing on new charges (2 bail sheets).  All matters adjourned to 3/30 at 2:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-23-2016 02:30 pm
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-02-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 9:05 a.m. Warrant from yesterday quashed. Formal reading waived; rights stated; AIA completed. Prelim time limits waived. Status requested. Court sets as AIA as reminder prelim not yet held.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

4:15 p.m.  Phone call from Atty. Whitney - is aware that def and clerk have attempted to reach him following def's missed appearance this afternoon. (Def called the clerk at approx. 2:15, stating that he overslept.)  Atty. Whitney asks for this case to be calendared tomorrow (Wed) morning at 9.  Clerk has attempted to reach def by phone but is unable to as his vm box is not yet set up.  Atty. W will attempt to reach def as well.
Adjourned initial appearance at 02-17-2016 09:00 am

Attorney Jameson R. Whitney in court for Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars not in court. Comment by Atty Whitney re. def's non-appearance. DA requests warrant. Warrant is authorized.

Defendant Jonathan S. Kovars appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody and represented - for this hearing only - by Atty. McDougal.  SPD office has advised that they will be appointing counsel other than McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states charges; will adjourn this hearing to a later date to allow SPD time to appoint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
